page.title: 11'PRIDEWOOD' ASHPERTON
page.content: Pridewood is very much today as always been _ mainly hops. Hereford bulls were once breed and shown to a very high standard from the farm. There is a very small non_descript herd there now. The farmhouse is in need of extensive renovation, this is now in hand for this coming year. The new owners have no previous experience in farming _ the farm will be managed by Mr.Cecil Matthews who has been at Pridewood for well over 30 years. Note that there were 14 people working on the farm 30 years ago and today it is worked by just 2 people,the only domestic help that is retained is a part time gardener. One of the features of Pridewood is its very interesting garden, there are two unusual trees on the front lawn - a Mulberry and a Weeping Ash. The gardens are to be fully restored.
